publicationstmt.publisher: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-07 04:32:05 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

physdesc.extent: 17 of the 24 digital objects comprise 3,838 files.

did.abstract: University Information Technology (UIT) is a university-wide service dedicated to the strategic planning, implementation and support of technical products and services for the Tufts community. This collection contains records of UIT and the Office of the Chief Information Officer, including reports, brochures, posters, presentations, communications, meeting minutes, photos and videos.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: University records are closed for 20 years from the date of their creation. Records older than 20 years that do not pertain to student education, staff and faculty employment and Board of Trusteees records are open for research. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA or further details.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the University Information Technology Office, 2008-2020.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Go-Pro videos of a Tufts Technology Services bowling outing that were part of accession UA-2020-052 were not retained due to their large file size and lack of research value. Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, contacted the Office of the Chief Information Officer to inform them of this decision and ensure they had access to the original files if necessary.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in received order in two series: Additional accessions, and the Office of the Chief Information Officer records.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: University Information Technology (UIT) is a university-wide service dedicated to the strategic planning, implementation and support of technical products and services that anticipate and meet the academic and business needs of the Tufts community. Under the direction of the Vice President and Chief Information Officer, UIT delivers information technologies to the university that faciliate teaching, learning, research, administration and outreach.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: University Information Technology Records, 1993 -- 2019. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: This collection is minimally processed. In June 2020, Margaret Peachy, Digital Archivist, processed accession UA-2020-052, the records of Chief Information Officer David Kahle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: University Information Technology (UIT) is a university-wide service dedicated to the strategic planning, implementation and support of technical products and services that anticipate and meet the academic and business needs of the Tufts community. This collection contains the records of UIT and the Office of the Chief Information Officer including reports, brochures, posters, presentations, communications, meeting minutes, photos, and videos.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

did.unittitle: Strategic plans, budget proposals and reports; TCCS five year plan, Turn Futility into Utility pamphlet, and Strategic Plan
ITC/TCCS binders and general IT policies
Mobile Mindfulness posters and tote bag and pen/paper; Compute Safely brochures

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts Technology Services newsletters and brochures, TAB survival kit, Next Generation Directory, and Trusted Identity Management Committee records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Identity Management Steering committee

did.unittitle: Office of the Chief Information Officer records

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Office of the Chief Information Officer, February 2020, accession UA-2020-052.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series was processed by Margaret Peachy, Digital Archivist, and Jane Kelly, Records and Accessioning Archivist, in July 2020. The Digital Archivist accessioned all the material in the BitCurator environment with the exception of Go-Pro videos of a Tufts Technology Services bowling outing, which were appraised as non-permanent records. Each top-level folder served as the basis for a zip file, with the exception of "Administrative files and video footage of David Kahle," which contains smaller directories and loose files. The Records and Accessioning Archivist created metadata for each zip file.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Office of the Chief Information Officer. These records include presentations, reports, communications, meeting minutes, photos, and videos. The material dates from 2010 to 2019, which includes David J. Kahle's tenure as Tufts' Vice President for Information Technology and Chief Information Officer from 2009 to 2018. These records document the Office of the Chief Information Officer and Tufts Technology Services (TTS) more generally, including records of committees and external partnerships, presentations and documentation about TTS for Tufts faculty and staff, photographs of TTS outings and staff events, New England Association of Schools and Colleges accreditation documents, and information on hiring and personnel.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order in one sub-series: David J. Kahle records.

did.unittitle: Administrative files and video footage of David Kahle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder originally contained one file about TTS. Files that were not within a folder were bundled with this single item and video footage of David Kahle.

did.unittitle: Annual Report for Executive Vice President's Office

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Annual reports for the Executive Vice President's Office.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents related to Tufts Technology Services' design thinking and service design practices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photos, videos, and other material related to former Tufts Chief Information Officer David J. Kahle's memorial.

did.unittitle: New England Association of Schools and Colleges accreditation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts Technology Services reports and contributions to the NEASC Accreditation process, including documents related to the School of the Museum of Fine Arts and Tufts' NEASC 5 Year Interim Report.

did.unittitle: Office of the Chief Information Officer key presentations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meeting presentations and supporting documents for faculty, staff, trustees, and Tufts' executive leadership. Presentations cover information security audits, administration and finance, IT support, and town hall updates.

did.unittitle: Office of the Chief Information Officer meetings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Presentations and related documents for meetings with various groups. These groups include: Administration & Planning Subcommittee, external partners and groups, CIO Council, Digital Humanities - Support Structures for Programs at Tufts, Enterprise Operations, Executive Vice President Staff Council, Faculty IT Liaison Program, IT Advisory Committee, IT Leaders Forum, Provost's Office, Support Services Steering Team, Trustees, Tufts Library Council, and University Risk and Compliance Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records of IT operations, including material related to the Federal Communications Commission, Tufts Service Desk Requests for Proposals, the School of the Museum of Fine Arts, and the Tufts network. Also includes records created by Compliance Process Partners, LLC, related to IT Service Management at Tufts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Presentations and reports about Tufts Technology Services for members of the senior leadership at Tufts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents related to video conferencing and collaboration tools, including WebEx and Box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meeting documents related to communications, program plans, IT resources, customer satisfaction metrics, strategic plans, IT organizational structure, organizational design and personnel, and executive committee meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Staff newsletters, memos, and presentations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Presentations and videos from monthly Tufts Technology Services Forums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from Tufts Technology Services social events, including holiday parties and summer outings.

did.unittitle: Tufts Technology Services service disruption reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reports about disruptions to TTS services.

did.unittitle: Tufts Distinctiom Awards - Tufts Technology Services submissions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts Technology Services submissions to the Tufts Distinction Awards, which recognize the exceptional accomplishments of faculty and staff.
